item.title: Avowed Game Director Reveals New Details About Companions
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/avowed-game-director-reveals-new-details-about-companions/

Avowed’s Game Director, Carrie Patel, has disclosed details on how companions interact with the player in the upcoming game. 

“More Interactivity and Reactivity”

In conversation with GamesRadar+, Carrie Patel discussed how they wanted to provide “a little more interactivity and reactivity” to companions “based on the events and conversations and quests that you’re encountering in the game.” Patel added that they wanted companions “to have a little bit more to say” about their journey together. 

Patel then goes on to talk about how engaging with companions is a significant part of RPGs, but finding the ‘balance’ is also crucial. They didn’t want Avowed’s companions to “feel like someone is backseat driving and second-guessing all your choices.” Patel also compared Avowed’s companions to Starfield’s, stating that they won’t have as extreme reactions when you do something ‘evil’ but will provide some form of pushback. 

Avowed’s Companions Will Have Opt-In Engagement

Patel then talks about the opt-in engagement players can experience with companions in Avowed. The developers have “written a lot of content for these characters for their engagement in the story with one another, with the player.” However, it’s up to the players whether they want to explore this content. For example, when they return to the party camp, players “might hear their companion say a thing or two”, but they decide whether to have the conversation and “get to know their companion a bit better.”

item.title: Demon Slayer: The Hinokami Chronicles 2 Confirmed for 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/demon-slayer-the-hinokami-chronicles-2-confirmed-for-2025/

Demon Slayer: The Hinokami Chronicles 2 will be released for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam in 2025. 

Sega has released an announcement trailer for Demon Slayer: The Hinokami Chronicles 2, revealing new details about the upcoming title. Firstly, players get to see glimpses of all 9 Hashiras and their special moves: Giyu Tomioka, Kyōjurō Rengoku, Tengen Uzui, Shinobu Kocho, Muichiro Tokito, Mitsuri Kanroji, Obanai Iguro, Sanemi Shinazugawa and Gyomei Himejima. All 9 Hashiras will be playable in the upcoming title. 

The Demon Slayer: The Hinokami Chronicles 2 announcement trailer also gives fans a glimpse of the sequel’s story, featuring three new arcs. The upcoming game will let players experience the events of the Entertainment District Arc, The Swordsmith Village Arc, and The Hashira Training Arc. Lastly, the sequel’s roster will feature 40 playable characters, including all the base game and DLC characters from the original title.
